CatDescriptText: William J. Brennan, hoseman, Crucible Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 27, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that newspapers influence public opinion as much today as they did in past? Do you believe that they are 'free' to tell the truth, or do factors like advertising, politics, friendships, etc., influence coverage and presentation?"  Answer reads: "Newspapers today are just as influential as those of yesteryears.  Good editorials are big things for common people...Newspapers today are as fair and square as they were yesterday."
TitMainTitle: William J. Brennan wearing double breasted fire fighter dress uniform with medal pinned to jacket, dark necktie, eyeglasses, and dark hat with badge, facing man holding notebook, standing on Liberty Avenue with May Building with Thrift Drugs store
